p: Bezerra et al. [14] obtained a particularly high rate of virus coinfection (39.6%); only one pathogen was identified in 46% of cases. Few studies have examined the correlation between virus coinfection and the clinical severity of ALRTI, and the results are contradictory. Semple et al. [43] and Greensill et al. [44] showed that HMPV and RSV coinfections correlate with the severity of clinical signs. Bezerra et al. [14] did not find a correlation between the severity of respiratory infection and bacterial coinfection. We did not analyse this correlation in our sample because of the small number of people coinfected with RSV/HMPV or RSV/HRV.
